Tor Browser Bundle for GNU/Linux

27 Mar 2010

Tor Browser Bundle for GNU/Linux is now available for x86 and x86_64 architectures in 12 languages.

The Tor Browser Bundle lets you use Tor without needing to install any software. It can run off a USB flash drive, comes with a pre-configured web browser and is self-contained.

You can download it from the Tor Browser page which also has instructions about how to extract and use it.

The bundle comes with the following software:

  • Tor 0.2.2.10-alpha
  • Vidalia 0.2.7 -- cross-platform controller GUI for the Tor software
  • Polipo 1.0.4.1 -- caching web proxy
  • Firefox 3.5.8 -- web browser
  • Torbutton 1.2.4 -- Firefox extension to enable or disable the browser's use of Tor
  • NoScript 1.9.9.57 -- Firefox extension to only allow scripts from trusted sites
  • BetterPrivacy 1.4.7 -- Firefox extension to protect against supercookies

This is a beta version, so please test it and file bugs!
